result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott T Dvorak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession, Use of Marijuana or Synthetic Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay. apply bond.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Possession, Use of Marijuana or Synthetic Marijuana
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Scott T Dvorak in court with attorney Sheila M. Smith.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State moves to amend Count 2 to Possession, Use of Marijuana or Synthetic Marijuana ordinance violation.

State has extended an offer.
Def is requesting an adjournment.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott T Dvorak in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Deft wants to contest one of the charges.
The state told the deft to go to the SPD's office after the pre-trial at the last court date.
Deft has not gone to the SPD's office.
BTC: One more status date set, deft must go to the SPD's office after court today,  Attorney information given to defendant.
  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Scott T Dvorak in court.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
